^ what dacin said
the LM3 thing you showed off last time is also fixed btw
was an easy fix in the settings as it turns out, still reported it in case fusoya actually wants to fix it
what was the fix?
solution was just to set the vertical spawn range to infinite
which also sets the despawn range to infinite so they don't despawn
unless they fall out the level which is what you'd expect
ah so infinite still despawns sprites below the level
yea
on a side note, I'm a bit surprised infinite isn't the default then.
^ I said the same thing when I reported it
it kind of makes sense because infinite is pretty bad for actual LM3 sizes but still
I meant that more in a how it'd be implemented kind of thing
you have to automatically switch the setting if you change the LM3 sizes unless the user manually set it in which case you shouldn't and keeping track of state seems annoying
yeah that's what I meant by "it makes sense" I doubt fusoya will change the default but I mentioned it so we'll see
can't you just have a pop-up when you change the level size that asks you whether you want to change the spawn range to a suggested one?
but do you really change the level size that often?
stuff like that doesn't really have a "everyone will be happy" solution
thanks!
I hope we'll be out of this room by the end of the stream at least lul

here we go
bounce sprite = the part with graphics that changes the layer 1 block, quake sprite = the part that hits other sprites.
usually, you have both a bounce and a quake sprite.
but their sprite slot rules are a bit different, so you can get one without the other.
it's as if the comment on the right describes the code on the left.
maybe it's in order?
no none of that nonesense, $1632 is not loaded into Y
it just preserves Y
0 = player is not climbing, yes
why?
"player is climbing flag"
it just describes the format in more detail
it means that it's set if the body collision point is on a climbable tile
I guess that's fair
yeah
idk to me it's clear by the fact that it says "Player is climbing flag" but I guess it could be ambigous
*+u apparently
fair enough
so essentially what's happening here is that that routine is the same routine that also handles punching sprites while on a net
if you climb, it interacts with sprites on the opposite side of the "net" the player is on, just that y'know, quake sprites do the same thing because of that
